Name: loudoun_2008_landfill_water_district
LayerDisplayName: Landfill Water Service District (LWSD),  Loudoun County, VA 2007
Abstract: The LWSD layer identifies the water service area that is supplied with water from the Loudoun County Sanitation Authority (LCSA).  It identifies both the orignial   expanded Service District areas, which are identified in the layer's attributes. The original area was drafted first and extended a mile from the landfill perimeter. The original LWSD was amended by the Loudoun County General Plan, which resulted in the expansion area.  The expansion area was derived from the parcels that intersected the LCSA water lines from the east.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<metadata>
  <idinfo>
    <citation>

      <ftname Sync="TRUE">loudoun_2008_landfill_water_district</ftname>
</citeinfo>
    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>The LWSD layer identifies the water service area that is supplied with water from the Loudoun County Sanitation Authority (LCSA).  It identifies both the orignial & expanded Service District areas, which are identified in the layer's attributes. The original area was drafted first and extended a mile from the landfill perimeter. The original LWSD was amended by the Loudoun County General Plan, which resulted in the expansion area.  The expansion area was derived from the parcels that intersected the LCSA water lines from the east.</abstract>
      <purpose>The LWSD layer is to identify the areas that are supplied with water by LCSA only. The Loudoun County Board of Supervisors adopted a resolution that due to potential pollution sources, no drilling of water wells should occur in the LWSD.  The LWSD layer should be used in combination with the parcels database to identify those new & existing parcels that should not undertake drilling.</purpose>
      <supplinf>Data are stored in the corporate ArcSDE Geodatabase as a polygon feature class.  The coordinate system is Virginia State Plane (North), Zone 4501, datum NAD83 HARN (vertical datum, if applicable, NAVD88), US Survey foot units.</supplinf>
    </descript>

      <procstep>
        <procdesc>An undocumented shapefile of the original Landfill Water Service District (LWSD) was compared to a georeferenced copy of map L97-0041 to determine that parcel and drainage data were necessary to reconstitute the district.  The required parcel and drainage data were then imported from Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI cd Vol1_No1_May25_1999 into personal geodatabase and reprojected to County standard.  Of the available vector data, the 1999 data had the strongest temporal relationship to the original map.  The determination to use the 1999 data was made after a comparison of the 1999 data to the undocumented shapefile and georeferenced copy of L97-0041 yielded no appreciable differences.  The parcel and drainage features were then traced to create the Landfill Water Service District (LWSD) feature class.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2007</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, Building & Development</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Administration</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>The 1999 data was again chosen to be used because of its temporal relationship and matching feature representation with visual comparisons being  performed against map number CPRV-W-053.  The LCSA water line feature class was also imported and reprojected as supplemental data.  The expansion area was then delineated based on the parcels identified in CPRV-W-053.  This expansion area was then joined with the original area to create a single LWSD.  The original & expansion areas are differentiated in the attribute field.

This expansion area was then joined with the original area to create a single LWSD.  The original & expansion areas are identified in the attribute field</procdesc>
        <procdate>2007</procdate>

            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>

        </proccont>
      </procstep>
